                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let us consider one individual vertex. 
A diagonal is a line formed when that vertex and another point are joined. However, if a point is directly adjacent to it, the line formed will not be a diagonal (it will be an edge). Also, it is obvious that the point itself cannot be chosen (no line formed). Therefore a vertex will be formed between that vertex, and all but three (one on each side and the point itself) of the other vertices. This is true for all the vertices. Thus, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=x(x-3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (so far)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"However, connecting vertices A and B forms the same diagonal as connecting B and A. We are therefore counting each individual diagonals as two distinct diagonals, which is not true, so we must divide by 2. Therefore our function becomes "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)=1/2*x(x-3)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"and finally, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(10,000)=49985000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 10000 followers follow up problem
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assume today is December 1st."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"On Jun 1 Calvin had 5000 followers and the amount of followers he had doubled every 6 months.  Today, he has 10000."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I began brilliant with one follower on Jun 1 and now I have 500 followers as the amount of followers I had has been multiplied by 500 every 6 months."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assuming the rates at which we gain followers remains exactly constant, how many days after Dec. 1 will it be before I have as many followers as Calvin? Answer to two decimal places."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assume: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"All months have 30 days"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"You may use a computer software"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Logic does not apply (by this I mean exclude the fact that I probably will never have as many followers as Calvin, base your calculations explicitly off of the information given)"}]}]}
